name: Idiopathic Laryngeal Neuropathic Syndrome (ILNS)
chief_complaint: Persistent throat pain and voice changes that feel like electric shocks when speaking
symptoms: Globus sensation (feeling of a lump in throat)
physical_findings: Mild vocal tremor during sustained phonation

lab_results.Laryngeal EMG: Increased spontaneous activity in thyroarytenoid muscle

treatment: Gabapentin or pregabalin for neuropathic pain
Laryngeal botulinum toxin injections for refractory cases
Cognitive behavioral therapy for pain management
prognosis: Chronic but manageable condition; 60% achieve significant symptom reduction with multimodal therapy
description: A rare neuropathic disorder affecting the laryngeal nerves, characterized by chronic pain and sensory disturbances without structural abnormalities. Thought to involve small fiber neuropathy of the superior laryngeal nerve branches.
